Navigation
Name Rascal/Expressions/Values/Set/Product

Synopsis The product of two set values.
Syntax Exp1 * Exp2
Types
Exp1 Exp2 Exp1 * Exp2
set[T1] set[T2] rel[T1,T2]
Description Yields a relation resulting from the product of the values of Exp1 and Exp2. It contains a tuple for each combination of values from both arguments.
Examples 
rascal>{1, 2, 3} * {4, 5, 6};
rel[int, int]: {
  <2,4>,
  <3,5>,
  <1,6>,
  <2,5>,
  <3,4>,
  <1,5>,
  <2,6>,
  <1,4>,
  <3,6>
}
Questions
Question 1.
The type of {8, -12, -19, 0} * {-3, 8, -2, 17, -6} is

Question 2.
The type of {$2026-11-01T09:53:36.898+0100, $2026-05-04T22:26:32.885+0200, $2103-10-01, $2082-08-03T00:52:17.085+0200} * {$2014-06-05, $2094-01-03, $2077-02-01T21:55:01.848+0100} is

Question 3. 
{-2.936397105150310000, -6.090505324381445600, 5.05158168090074800, -9.856487142886618400} * {-15.185854853128111200, -12.04707792962547200} ==
